text: We fade up on a yellow WALKMAN, and hear Deee-Lite’s “Gro is in the Heart”. It belongs to A GUARD practicing his dance moves outside remote MOORISH PALACE. ANOTHER GUARD is more chilled. Unt On the horizon: a HELICOPTER comes in fast and low, FOUR ARMED MEN hanging from it, on ropes. They wear gas masks. The men shoot both Guards. Then they blow out the windows swing inside, expertly releasing from their ropes. Moments later, the palace windows BLOW OUT. Fire and smok billow. Through the comms, we hear, over gunshots:
Area secured... Eyes on the target... Target secured. We move in through a broken window to find...

The four operatives, tying A TERRORIST to a chair. The fi operative performs a swift body check, then removes his g mask. This is JACK LINCOLN, 32, handsome, calm and assure Another man removes his mask. Late 20s, black, good-looki His code name is MERLIN. He nods respectfully to Jack. A second follows suit. Early 20s, white, well-groomed, oo aristocratic confidence. He’ll come to be known as LANCEL It takes a nudge from Merlin to prompt the third to remov his mask. This is LEE, 22 - rugged face, army haircut and strong London accent. He looks to Jack, apologetic.
Sorry, sir. Jack draws a GUN and addresses his captive in perfect Ara
We know there's a second attack planned today. I need the location. It‘ll take five shots to take you beyond repa so I suggest you answer quickly.
Still no response. Jack shoots him swiftly in both legs. Terrorist screams and slumps forward.

That’s two. You don't want to find out where I'll put the third.  2. Jack aims for the Terrorist’s groin. The Terrorist sits u He's smiling. Between his teeth he holds: A GRENADE PIN. Without hesitation, Lee dives onto him, with a warning cr
Grenade! It DETONATES. Lee and the Terrorist are killed instantly. Jack, Lancelot and Merlin are blown back by the force, bu thanks to Lee, they’re alive. They pick themselves up.
Shit. I missed it. How did I fucking miss it?
Time was of the essence, sir. Could have happened to any one of us.
If it had been one of the trainees, it would have been forgivable. Jack glances regretfully at Lee. Then gathers himself.
Where does this leave us, Merlin?
Lee was the stronger candidate, sir. As I believe he just made evident. But Hugo’s test performances have been flawless. Merlin indicates Lancelot. Jack extends his hand to him.
Welcome to Huntsman.

A bleak, run-down estate. A LONDON TAXI pulls up. No ordinary cab - the interior looks like a gentlemen’s c Jack sits with a dignified older gent, ARTHUR, 50s. Arthu gazes out of the window with a look of disgust.
Revolting place.
We won't be here long.
I still dispute whether we need to be here at all.
“Rules are rules.” That’s your motto, isn’t it, Arthur?
The rules are for gentleman.
They’re for Huntsmen.
And that young man wasn’t one.
Not yet. But he behaved as much like a Huntsman as any of those smug elitists the others put forward for the job. If it weren't for him, I wouldn't be here.
Is that what’s troubling you, Galahad? Or the fact that your little experiment failed?
With respect, Arthur —- you're a snob,
With respect? Jack opens the car door and climbs out.
The world is changing. There's a reason aristocrats developed weak chins.
The front room of a small but neatly-kept flat. On the wa is a large framed shopping-mall portrait: Lee in army uni with his wife, MICHELLH, 20s, and their little son, BGGSY

We very much regret that your husband's bravery can’t be publicly celebrated. I hope you understand. On the floor, Eggsy plays with POKEMON CARDS, desperately trying to ignore the conversation, determined not to cry.
How can I if you won‘t tell me anything? I didn’t even know he wasn’t with his squad -- Now we see Jack and Michelle, sitting close by. Jack hold out a beautiful MEDAL. She takes it, studies it.

I’m so sorry I can’t say more. But I'd like to present you with this. It's a Guinevere Cross. Very rare, and to those who know what it is, very highly respected. (Michelle hands it back) I know it’s not much comfort. But -- See on the back here? That’s my number. AS a more concrete gesture of gratitude, I’d like to offer... Let’s call it a favour.
What do you mean?
The nature of it is your choice. Just tell the operator “oxfords not brogues,” then I’ll know it’s you.
Sorry, what? Who the hell are you?
Someone well-placed to help. But I’m afraid I can offer only one favour. So you may want to save it for an emergency. Jack holds the medal out to her again. She just stares.

I don’t need your help. I need my husband back. She gets up, walks to the door and opens it. Jack stands. looks at Eggsy, who stares doggedly at his cards. Jack la the medal on the Pokemon cards. Eggsy picks it up.
What’s your name, young man?
Eggsy.
Take care of that, Eggsy. And take good care of your mother, too.
A magnificent CHALET nestled near a snowy forest. ARMED GUARDS linger outside. Under a CAPTION: “17 YEARS LATER”.

Lavish decor, at odds with its occupants -- a hooded MAN to an art deco chair, surrounded by FIVE GOONS. The BIGGEST GOON carefully removes the hood, revealing th prisoner. This is PROFESSOR ALAN SWANSON, 40s. There's ga tape over his mouth. The goon starts to gently peel it of
So sorry, Professor Swanson. Just a tiny bit more, I’m trying not to -- The tape is half off now. The goon tugs gingerly at it.
For god's sake, just rip it off!
I’m under very strict instructions not to hurt you, but -- The goon complies, wincing. Swanson doesn't flinch.
Look, you’ve made a mistake. I'ma university lecturer. I’ve got no money.
God no, this isn’t about money. You're in no danger, our boss just wants to talk to you. He’s a fan.
Am I meant to find that reassuring?

Let me get you a drink. You're a whiskey man, right? Hey, Red? Can you get a selection of our finest single malts, please? Another Goon - RED - hustles out. Suddenly, Swanson’s expression shifts: first relief, then anger.
Wait, is this one of those prank TV shows?

Look, you'll have a drink, our boss will be here soon, he’1ll explain everything. Honestly, our whiskey selection? You will shit. We got a 1943 Dalmore that's just -- A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. The confused Goon goes to answer it. It's Lancelot. Late 30s now, and wearing an excellent sui he’s even more dashing and assured than in his youth.

I suppose asking to borrow a bowl of sugar is a step too far? Before anyone has a chance to respond, Lancelot draws his WEAPON and shoots every goon in the room. Stone dead. LANCELOT? (CONT’D) Professor Swanson. I'm here to take you home.

This... isn’t a TV show, is it. Behind him, Red re-enters carrying a TRAY of various rare malt whiskies. Seeing the carnage, he reaches for his gun But Lancelot spins around, shoots Red dead and lunges jus time to catch the tray in his free hand as Red crumples.

1943 Dalmore. It’d be a sin to spill any, don't you think? Suddenly there’s another KNOCK AT THE DOOR. Lancelot -- s holding the whiskey in one hand -- readies his weapon. Suddenly, from another room, a male figure cartwheels in unbelievable speed and agility. He wears a pair of paraly quality RUNNING BLADES. This is GAZELLE, 30s. Before he can react, Gazelle amputates Lancelot’s gun han with a graceful arc of one - apparently razor sharp - bla Lancelot drops the whiskey in shock. Gazelle catches it.. -.-And continues to hold it steadily throughout the brief intense fight that ensues. Lancelot gives it his best, bu he’s no match for Gazelle and his fearsome samurai runnin blades. The whiskey survives. Lancelot, alas, doesn’t. Swanson reacts in stunned shock. Gazelle casually strides away to answer the front door. It’s his boss, VALENTINE. He’s a Mark Zuckerberg type, 20 Valentine takes the whiskey, opens it and sniffs it happi

My kind of welcome. Then, taking in the carnage, and Swanson’s haunted face, moves to a nearby counter where he pours two glasses. VALENTINE (CONT’D) Looks like Professor Swanson could use a drop, too. Gazelle slices the terrified Swanson’s ropes, freeing him Valentine heads over with the whiskey. He hands a glass t Swanson, apologetic, and then downs his own in one.

I‘ll never get used to bloodshed. Makes me very nervous. (awkward pause) Looks like we have that in common! (pausing for a laugh that doesn‘t come) Truly, I mean you no harm. I've read all your papers, watched all your interviews. Like, I adore you, and wanna help you and I am so sorry you had to witness all this violence due to our unwanted guest. I promise you, by the time I’ve found out who he works for, you and I will be best of friends. INT. EGGSY’S ROOM - NIGHT 7 The photograph we saw before of Lee and his family stands propped up against a wall. We can hear GUNFIRE. Eggsy, now 21 and looking like someone who’d mug you for phone, lounges on his bed, playing Call of Duty. From 0.s over the gunfire, we hear:
Eggsy! I said come here! With a sigh, Eggsy pauses the game.

Eggsy enters. The room is now dirty, dilapidated. Michell looks worn down, slovenly. She’s slumped on the couch, smoking, flanked by two shady men: DEAN, 42 and KENZIE, 2 A TODDLER in a sagging diaper wanders around aimlessly.
You got any Rizlas, love?
No.
Go and get us some, then.
Get ‘em yourself.
Oi. What‘ve I said about talking to Dean like that? Eggsy looks at Dean with distaste, then nods at Kenzie.
Three’s a crowd, innit. Why don’t Dean's poodle go? Dean stands up. He’s big, intimidating. He produces a TEN POUND NOTE from his pocket and forces it into Eggsy’s han
Get your mum the Rizlas and some beers and I'l tell you what: while you're gone we’ll show her three can be good company. Eggsy struggles to control his impulse to deck Dean.
Give him twenty, Dean, then he can buy himself a drink and all. She whispers something in Dean’s ear. He smiles, pulls ou another tenner. Reluctantly, Eggsy takes it.

Cheers, love. And do me a favour, can you take your sister? She’s doing my head in. Seething, Eggsy scoops up the toddler and storms out. EXT. COUNCIL BLOCK HALLWAY - NIGHT. Eggsy stands in a windy, graffitied walkway, stabbing at ELEVATOR BUTTON. In his arms, his sister begins to grizzl Eggsy takes off his hoodie and wraps it around her.
That’s better, innit? He pushes the button again. Still nothing. Eggsy kicks th elevator door and heads for the urine-puddled stairwell.  10 11
An identical cold, dirty walkway. Eggsy stands at the ope door to a flat talking to an elderly Indian lady, MRS JOS
Oh come on Eggsy, not again.
I'll only be twenty minutes. She takes Eggsy’s sister. He kisses them both on the chee INT. PUB — NIGHT. 11 A grim pub. Eggsy sits in a corner drinking with two mate RYAN and JAMAL.
If Dean treats your mum so bad why don't she leave him?
Low self-esteem, that's her problem.
Fuck off, why would she have low self-esteem? Eggsy’s mum’s fit. Eggsy’s not really listening. He stares into his pint.
One of these days... I’m gonna smash his face in.

Are you mental, cuz? He'd just get that lot to do you and pretend he didn't know nothing about it. Without really thinking, Jamal points over at a bunch of GANG MEMBERS at a nearby table. They notice.
What you saying, blud?
Think you can chat shit about us and we won't do nothing just cos our guvnor’s banging Eggsy’s mum?
Pretty much, yeah. The first boy stands up and walks over to the table. He l over Eggsy, huge. Eggsy’s mates freeze. Jamal hisses to h  12 13
Leave it, fam. Let’s just go. They ain’t worth it. A tense stand off for a beat. Then Eggsy gets up and head for the door. His friends follow, relieved. The Gang JEER
Eggsy, Ryan and Jamal swagger out, trying as hard as they not to look like they‘ve retreated.
Yeah. Weren’t worth it. Jamal nods in agreement.. He and Ryan both pull up their before they walk on. Eggsy doesn’t follow them -- he walk towards the curb instead, stops at a PARKED CAR.
Why you walking? It's freezing. He produces a set of CAR KEYS and starts to unlock the ca
Who's car’s that? Eggsy gestures back towards the pub and grins.
His, innit. Took the keys out his pocket when he come over.
Shit, son! The boys all explode into laughter and pile into the car. doors slam shut, Eggsy guns the engine and the gang burst of the pub just in time to see Eggsy pulling out.
You’re fucking dead! Eggsy throws him a “wanker” hand gesture as he tears away
The car roars through the streets. Inside, the boys laugh uproariously.
Floor it, Egqgsy!
If they don’t: kill you, Dean will.  14 15 16 ll.
The only person with the right to kill me is whoever actually paid for this car. Suddenly, A SIREN. FLASHING LIGHTS.
Shit.
Did you have more than two pints?
Like that's my biggest problem.
Eggsy slams the car into reverse and guns into a side str
The TWO COPS watch, incredulous and grudgingly impressed.
Bloody hell.
(into the radio) Requesting back up --
Eggsy roars backwards up the side street. Tension and excitement in the car now. Suddenly a SECOND FOLICE CAR looms into view. Eggsy turns sharply onto a PEDESTRIAN ALLEY.
The fuck are you doing?

Feds car can’t get down here. He’s absolutely right. The police car slows, then drives Inside, the boys laugh hysterically. Eggsy backs fast out of the alley, onto another street, a broad grin on his face, until: A FOX runs across the road Eggsy swerves to avoid it... And loses control. The car hurtles towards the pavement and hits a LAMP-POST.  17 18 19 12. SMOKE pours from under the hood. The first police car tur into the street, sirens blaring.
The airbag has inflated. Eggsy struggles behind it, tryin get his seat-belt undone.
Dickhead!
Foxes are vermin, cuz! You should’ve driven it over! Eggsy'’s seat-belt is jammed. Outside, a second siren how

I should've done a lot of things. I'll sort this. Get out. {off their confused looks) I said get out. They do. As they run, Eggsy accelerates violently, SMASHI into the Police Car, giving his friends an escape route.

A charming London mews. The camera cranes down to a copy TABLOID NEWSPAPER lying outside the front door of one hou The door opens and a hand picks it up. We jib up to revea Jack, now 49, sporting a beautiful tailored dressing gown He smiles as he reads the headline -- “BIKINI READY! KIM KARDASHIAN LOSES 15LBS” -- then shuts the door. INT. JACK’S HOUSE — DAY. 19 As we follow Jack inside, we realize that the mews house in fact, huge -~ the whole row has been knocked through. In Jack’s study area, a classic silver TEAPOT and bone Ch cup stands on his desk. The walls are covered in FRAMED TABLOID NEWSPAPER HEADLINES. Each more trivial than the l Jack discards his tabloid, settles at his computer and st to read the Financial Times online while sipping his tea. We track in to his wrist to see: a magnificent Dent WATCH thin that it looks painted on. Suddenly, the face glows r Jack presses a button on the watch and hastily gets up.  20 21 22 13.
The discreet, classy shop-front of a tailors shop on Lond Savile Row. The awning reads: “HUNTSMAN. ESTABLISHED 1849 Jack's classic Bristol CAR pulls up outside and Jack alig
A couple of WELL-DRESSED TAILORS nod respectfully to Jack
Arthur is in the dining room, six.
Arthur, now late 60s, sits alone at a large table. He wea GLASSES. Before him: am exquisite DECANTER, a BRANDY SNIF and a leather bound FILE. There are twelve empty chairs.
Arthur.

Galahad. Finally. The others were concerned that we may be making a double toast. There's another brandy at one seat. Jack sits down here a retrieves a pair of GLASSES like Arthur’s. He puts them o JACK'S POV: The previously empty seats are now occupied - TEN GENTLEMEN, wearing wonderful suits and identical glas Jack exchanges nods of greeting with them. Then his eyes alight on the single EMPTY SEAT. His face registers disma
So I take it that it’s Lancelot we're drinking to.

I'm sorry. Now we're all present... Gentlemen, I'm thankful to say that it’s been seventeen years since we last had occasion to use this decanter. And, as ever, the circumstances make even a 1815 Napoleonic brandy taste bitter. Lancelot was an outstanding agent and a true Huntsman, and he will be sorely missed. (vaising his glass) To Lancelot.  23 14. JACK'S POV: the other agents have brandy snifters too. Th raise them solemnly, then down the brandy in one.

To matters practical, before we disperse, One: Galahad will take over Lancelot:‘s current mission. Two: I intend to begin the selection process for Lancelot's replacement tomorrow. I expect each of you to propose a candidate and have them report to UK HQ no later than nine PM GMT. Thank you. JACK'S POV: The other agents acknowledge the order before removing their glasses. As they do, they disappear from v
Eggsy is sitting in front of A POLICEMAN and POLICEWOMAN, staring at a DOCUMENT that lies on the table between them
I just wanna get this straight, right? If I sign this, and then I tell you who stole the truck with all them flat screen TV’s last month, you give me full immunity.
That’s right. And the alternative is, you go down, And you’re looking at eighteen months. At least.
I can just walk right out of here? The officers nod. Eggsy smiles, signs the document and ha it over. The officers stare, waiting with baited breath.
The person who stole the truck is... the person you’re looking at right now. (getting up) Nice doing business with you. The Policeman leaps up and slams Eggsy onto the desk.
Oh come on, bruv! A deal‘s a deal.
Doesn’t work like that. Nice try, though.  24 15.
You can give us hames, or we can just bin it. It’s up to you.
I wanna exercise my right to make a phonecall. The policeman lets go of him,
I hope it’s to your mum to say you're going to be eighteen months late for dinner. Eggsy reaches inside his tee-shirt for the gold chain he’ wearing. Hanging off it is the Guinevere Cross.
Arthur passes Jack the file. Jack opens it. Behind Arthur beautiful, ornate antique MIRROR transforms into: A SCREE
Lancelot was investigating a group of mercenaries experimenting with biological weaponry. ON THE SCREEN: a horrific image of NAKED, BLOODIED AFRICA MEN. They appear to be trying to eat one another.
Uganda, 2012. Synthetic cathinones.
Like bath salts? The street drug?
They put it in the water supply at a guerilla army base... Rage... Cannibalism. Multiple fatalities. ON THE SCREEN: a room filled with bullet-riddled CORPSES.
Chechnya, 2013. Insurgents turned on one another. Indisputably caused by our mercenaries. But this time, no trace of chemicals of any kind.
Unconnected with the first attack?
All their attacks were unconnected. And none could be linked to any one political interest.  16.
Well they are mercenaries... So, what happened to Lancelot?
I’m afraid this is where the story becomes a little... odd. On the screen: A photo of the high-security MOUNTAIN CHAL

He tracked them to this property, in Argentina. And while he had them under surveillance, he became aware that they'd effected a kidnapping. He tried to execute a solo rescue mission. Failed. This was his last transmission... On the screen: words appear. “KIDNAP VICTIM IS PROFESSOR SWANSON.”
Doesn’t sound especially odd. Who is he?

Some climate change doom-sayer. Expounds something called Gaia Theory. Overpopulation as a virus, earth trying to heal itself or some such. What’s curious is that he’s not actually missing. This is him. In London this morning. On the screen: a CCTV IMAGE OF THE PROFESSOR appears.
Well, it’s all yours. And don’t forget your membership proposal. Arthur slides the file to Jack, who stands to leave.
Nine PM at base. Absolutely.
Try picking a more suitable candidate this time.
(amused) Seventeen years... And still, evolving with the times remains an entirely foreign concept to you.  25 26 27 17.
With some uncertainty, Eggsy dials the number on the back the medal. It rings. Eggsy reacts in surprise and delight
Customer complaints, how may I help you?

Ummm, my name is Eggsy Price and... Sorry, Chester Price. And I’m up shit creek. I’m in Camberwell police station and... My mum told me to call this number if I ever needed help. And... Yeah. I need help. So... Hello? You still there?
I‘m sorry sir, I think you have a wrong number,
Wait! Wait! Oxfords not bragues?
Certainly, sir. Please hold. Questionable lounge music plays down the phone. The longe Eggsy stays on hold, the more surreal this all seems to h
Thank you for holding, sir. Your complaint has been duly noted, and we hope that we have not lost you as a loyal customer. The line goes dead. Eggsy’s face falls. Great.
The policeman we saw before is filling in paperwork. The PHONE RINGS on his desk. He answers. Listens a moment. Th
You what??... I... Yes. Yes, I totally understand. He really doesn’t.
It‘s raining. Eggsy exits. Jack igs outside, in his CAR.
Eggsy! Would you like a lift home?  28
Who are you?
The man who got you released. INT. JACK’S CAR - DAY. Eggsy has never seen a car like this before.
Is this a kit car?
Its a Bristol. One of the finest examples of British engineering.
So it’s shit, then.
It’s only seven minutes to your flat from here. Do you really want to spend it talking about my car?
How do you know where I live?
When are you going to ask me a more interesting question?
Alright, here's two. Who the fuck are you and how'd you get me out?
Badly phrased, but a good effort. My name is Jack Lincoln, I work for a London tailors called Huntsman and I gave you that cross. Your father saved my life.
You were in the army? Like, an officer?
Not quite.
Never met anybody who knew my dad. ‘Cept my mum, obviously. Listen, can I buy you a drink, though? Like, to say thank you? 18. 28
Splendid idea. They pull up outside the dodgy pub Eggsy was at last nigh Jack reaches into the back seat for an UMBRELLA.
Yeah, no... Not here. You won't like it, trust me.
Nonsense. It says they have draught Guinness. What more can one ask?
The pub is empty. Eggsy’s face floods with relief. At the bar, the BARMAN eyes Eggsy suspiciously.
Two halves of Guinness.
(handing over a TENNER) Make it two pints, please.
Cheers. So, where were you posted, you and my dad? Iraq or something?
I'm sorry, Eggsy. Classified.
I thought my mum had been on the erack pipe when she told me about the number. Feel guilty now. They take their drinks to a corner table. Jack downs half his Guinness. Eggsy sips his.

So. Want to know something about your dad? The day he died, I missed something. And if it weren't for your dad's courage, my mistake would have cost the lives of every Man present. So I owe him. He was a brave man. A good man. And having read your filles, I think he’d be bitterly disappointed in the choices you've made.
Whoa, hold the fuck up. You can’t just say shit about me like that!  20.
I can and I will. Huge I9, great performance at primary school... Then it all went tits up. Drugs, petty crime, never had a job...
Think there’s a lot of jobs going round here, do you?
Doesn’t explain why you quit the paras. You were halfway through training. And doing brilliantly, I might add. But you gave up.

Because my mim went mental? Banging on about losing me as well as my dad. Didn't want me being cannon fodder for snobs like you. Judging people like me from your ivory towers with no thought about why we do what we do. We ain’t got much choice, you get me? And if we was born with the same silver spoon up our arses, we'd do just as well as you. If not better. Eggsy’s so worked up that he hasn’t even noticed that the Gang Boys have come in. And they’re looking right at him.
The fuck are you doing here? You taking the piss? Eggsy leaps up. Jack doesn’t move. Eggsy tugs his sleeve.
Some more examples of young men who simply need a silver suppository?
No, there are exceptions. Come on. Jack watches apathetically as the gang walk towards them.
Nonsense, we haven’t finished our drinks. The barman watches too, anxious. He’s not going to interv The gang reach Eggsy and Jack's table.
I told Dean what you done. He said that makes you fair game. He don't give a shit what your mum says.  21.

Listen, boys, I’ve had a really frustrating day. Whatever your beef with Eggsy is -- and I’m sure it's well-founded -- I'd appreciate it enormously iff you could just leave us in peace until I’ve finished this lovely pint of Guinness. The boys exchange incredulous looks.
Better get out the way, grandad, or you're gonna get hurt and all.
He ain't joking. You should go. A beat. Then Jack gets up, retrieves his umbrella and hea for the door.
You want another rent boy, they're on the cornex of Smith Street! The gang all LAUGH. Jack doesn’t react, keeps walking. He reaches the door... And bolts it shut. He turns back around to face them.
Manners maketh the man. Do you know what that means? (off the stunned silence) Then let me teach you a lesson. Eggsy watches, staggered, as Jack approaches First Gang B

Well? Are we going to stand around all day or are we going to fight? The gang are just about. to erupt into shocked laughter w CRACK! Jack lands a mighty right hook, followed up by a s elbow to the jaw. The Hoy goes down like a sack of potato A beat -- disbelief -- then the rest of the gang rush Jac And there follows the most one-sided five-on-one fight we ever seen. Jack systematically beats the crap out of the remaining Gang Boys, using a breathtaking combination of exceptional fighting skills and incredible SPY GADGETS. Jack's UMBRELLA turns out to have a multitude of function Two boys have KNIVES - a MAGNET in Jack’s watch disarms t One boy grabs Jack's wrist to get the watch -- it gives h an electric shock.  30

At one point, Jack sees the Barman getting out his phone. Jack gets out his LIGHTER... Which releases a DART. The d flies into the man’s neck, and he collapses. In no time, all six gang boys are on the floor, out cold. Eggsy stares at Jack. Jack meets his eye, apologetic.

Sorry about that. Needed to let off a little steam. Heard this morning that a friend of mine died. He knew your father, too, actually. Funny. Eggsy glances over with concern at the unconscious barman JACK (CON'T’D) He’ll be alright. Just a tranquilizer. With a little something thrown in to blank a couple of hours memory. Not terribly different to what they give you at the dentist. He pulls out his lighter again... and points it at Egqsy. Eggsy backs away, hands; held up defensively.
I do apolog. , Eggsy. I shouldn't have done this in front of you.
No, please! I won't say nothing, I swear! If there’s one thing I can do it’s keep my mouth shut. Ask the feds! I've never grassed anyone up!
You won’t tell a soul, is that a promise?
On my life. Jack lowers the lighter and claps Eggsy on the shoulder.
Much appreciated, Eggsy. And you're right about the snobs. But there too, there are exceptions. Best of luck with everything.
Close on Valentine, holding up a photograph of Lancelot. he sighs, puts it down. We can’t see who he’s talking to.  31 23.

Great. You don‘t know, the CIA don’t know, no one knows who this guy is. Fine. Seriously, it’s fine. Well, it’s not actually fine. But it’s not why I’m here. He puts the photograph away in a briefcase, then leans in

Look, you know me. Money has never been my issue. All I ever heard at Princeton was how lucky I was to inherit an oil fortune. So I went to MIT instead, and then my tech company is worth more than my oil company, knock myself off the Forbes top spot, yada yada. Point is, you know where the profit went. (a beat) Tried to save the planet. Climate change research, lobbying. Years of work. Billions of dollars. And you know why I quit? Because last time I checked, the planet was still screwed. So here’s my epiphany: money can’t solve this. The idiots who call themselves politicians have buried their heads in the sand, stood for nothing but re- election. The last two years, I've looked for a real solution. And I found it. And if you really want to make the world a better place, listen the hell up, very carefully, because I’m gonna tell it to you. We pull back to reveal that Valentine is in The Oval Offi talking to THE PRESIDENT.

Go on, Mr Valentine. As usual, I'm all ears. INT. EGGSY'S MUM’S FLAT - SUNSET. 31 Michelle and Dean are watching TV, Dean playing a game on Iphone, Michelle texting. Eggsy’s sister sleeps beside th The door opens and Eggsy enters. Michelle and Dean leap u
Where the heil have you been?! Gone all night, all day, I've been worried sick, Mrs Joshi said -- She breaks off in shock as Dean punches Eggsy. Hard.  32 24.
Dean! Dean proceeds to beat the crap out of Eggsy. Eggsy tries fight back, but Dean is huge. Michelle screams in protest

Shut your mouth! I’ve had it with him. He needs to learn some respect. Winding up my business associates, nicking their car! (to Eggsy, punching him) And now your mate‘s gone and put four of ‘em in hospital. Who is he? Who was you with in the pub?
No one!

You're gonna fucking tell me or I’ll rip your head off, I swear. As Dean punches Eggsy again, we track past Dean’s fist... land on a tiny DOT on Eggsy‘s shoulder. Right where Jack patted him. We track in until darkness fills the screen..
